about_the_game:
THIS IS THE DEMO VERSION OF VALIDATE STRUGGLING SINGLES IN YOUR AREA. ALL CHARACTERS FEATURED IN PROMOTIONAL MEDIA WILL BE SET IN THE FULL GAME.

For more information please visit our website at

Want to see updates? Check out our Twitter!

ValiDate is a visual novel about thirteen struggling singles navigating through soul-sucking 9-to-5s, quarter-life crises, and the harsh truths millennials learn as soon as they hit their 20’s.

Set in the Jercy City area, our cast of lovers trudge through the dregs of capitalism - a journey, a transition - a rite-of-passage that leads into uncertain mid-adulthood. On one side but not yet out on the other, 13 playable characters find romance amongst cosplay, trash mixtapes, and even poetry straight from the soul.

With over 30 routes to choose from and hours of content, the lives of these singles are in your good (or bad!) decision-making hands.

content_descriptors.notes: This game contains mentions and references to drugs, alcohol, sexual assault, cheating, abuse and other harsh themes. Viewer discretion is advised.

name: ValiDate Demo
reviews:
“In the words of many: the dating pool has pee in it. The ValiDate Demo captures the conflicting feelings of the romantic desire and pessimistic realism that comes with dating.”
The PSoybean Blog

“Validate actively bucks the trends that have ruled dating sim mechanics for a long time. The game tells you that these characters are meant to be more like real people that you can actually communicate with,rather than events you have to succeed through to date.”
Uppercut!

“ValiDate’s writing team is bringing more than fluff to the table. In the demo’s three playable dates, I was reminded of the existential anxiety of questioning all my life’s choices over cheddar biscuits and overwhelmed with empathy for a fellow victim of the pains of customer service.”
AIPT
short_description: Validate is a visual novel in which 13 adults in their 20’s attempt to overcome the trials and tribulations of modern life, all while finding friendship — and maybe even love.
